# Delegation Framework

## Purpose

Effective delegation multiplies your capacity. Bad delegation creates more work. This framework helps you delegate successfully.

---

## Delegation Readiness

### Can You Delegate This?

| Criteria | Yes | No |
|----------|-----|-----|
| SOP exists | ✓ | Document first |
| Clear inputs/outputs | ✓ | Define them |
| Quality is measurable | ✓ | Create criteria |
| Not relationship-dependent | ✓ | Keep it |
| Doesn't require your unique insight | ✓ | Keep it |
| Can provide feedback loop | ✓ | Build one first |

### The Delegation Matrix

```
            HIGH SKILL REQUIRED
                    │
    ┌───────────────┼───────────────┐
    │   TRAIN       │   KEEP        │
    │   then        │   (Your       │
    │   delegate    │   unique      │
LOW │               │   value)      │ HIGH
JUDGMENT────────────┼───────────────JUDGMENT
REQUIRED│           │               │ REQUIRED
    │   DELEGATE    │   SUPERVISE   │
    │   fully       │   closely     │
    └───────────────┼───────────────┘
                    │
            LOW SKILL REQUIRED
```

---

## Delegation Levels

### Level 1: Task Delegation
- Single task, clear scope
- You provide all inputs
- They execute and report back
- You review output

### Level 2: Process Delegation
- Ongoing responsibility
- They handle triggers
- Follow established SOP
- Report exceptions only

### Level 3: Outcome Delegation
- Responsible for results
- Decide how to achieve
- Report on metrics
- Escalate issues

### Level 4: Authority Delegation
- Own the function
- Hire/manage others
- Set processes
- Accountable for outcomes

---

## Delegation Briefing

### Essential Information

```markdown
## Task Brief: {Task Name}

### Context
Why this matters and how it fits the bigger picture.

### Objective
What success looks like (specific and measurable).

### Scope
- Include: {what's in scope}
- Exclude: {what's NOT in scope}

### Inputs
- {Resource 1}: {where to find it}
- {Resource 2}: {where to find it}

### Process
{Link to SOP or step-by-step if no SOP}

### Output
- Format: {how to deliver}
- Location: {where to put it}
- Deadline: {when needed}

### Quality Criteria
- [ ] {Criterion 1}
- [ ] {Criterion 2}
- [ ] {Criterion 3}

### Authority
- Can decide: {what they can decide}
- Must ask: {what requires approval}

### Communication
- Updates: {frequency and channel}
- Questions: {how to reach you}
- Blockers: {escalation path}

### Examples
{Link to or description of good examples}
```

---

## Who to Delegate To

### Virtual Assistant (VA)

**Best for:**
- Admin tasks
- Data entry
- Research
- Scheduling
- Email management
- Basic customer service

**Cost:** $5-25/hour

**Where to find:**
- Upwork
- Fiverr
- Belay
- Time Etc
- OnlineJobs.ph (Philippines)

### Freelancer

**Best for:**
- Design work
- Writing
- Development
- Marketing
- Specialized tasks

**Cost:** $25-150/hour

**Where to find:**
- Upwork
- Toptal
- 99designs
- Contra
- Industry-specific boards

### Contractor

**Best for:**
- Ongoing specialized work
- Part-time roles
- Project-based work
- Consistent needs

**Cost:** $30-200/hour

**Where to find:**
- Referrals
- LinkedIn
- Industry communities
- Contra

### AI Tools

**Best for:**
- Text generation
- Data analysis
- Code assistance
- Research synthesis
- Repetitive cognitive tasks

**Cost:** $20-200/month

**Tools:**
- Claude (analysis, writing)
- GPT (general tasks)
- Midjourney (images)
- Various specialized AI

---

## Delegation Communication

### Initial Handoff

1. **Written brief** (always)
2. **Verbal walkthrough** (for complex tasks)
3. **Q&A session** (encourage questions)
4. **First-task review** (detailed feedback)

### Ongoing Communication

| Frequency | Purpose | Format |
|-----------|---------|--------|
| Real-time | Blockers, urgent questions | Slack/chat |
| Daily | Progress, quick questions | Async message |
| Weekly | Review, planning | Video call |
| Monthly | Performance, relationship | Video call |

### Feedback Framework

**For positive feedback:**
```
"Your [specific work] on [task] was excellent because [specific reason].
This helped [impact]. Keep doing [specific behavior]."
```

**For improvement feedback:**
```
"On [specific task], I noticed [specific issue].
The impact was [consequence].
Next time, try [specific alternative].
The goal is [outcome we want]."
```

---

## Quality Control

### Review Levels

| Level | What | When |
|-------|------|------|
| Full review | Check everything | New delegate, new task |
| Spot check | Sample outputs | Established, occasional |
| Exception only | Review flagged items | Trusted, systematic |
| Metrics only | Check outcomes | Fully delegated |

### Quality Criteria Examples

**For content:**
- Factually accurate
- Matches brand voice
- No grammar/spelling errors
- Properly formatted

**For data:**
- Complete (no missing entries)
- Accurate (verified sources)
- Properly formatted
- Correctly categorized

**For customer service:**
- Response within SLA
- Follows tone guidelines
- Resolves issue (or escalates)
- Proper documentation

---

## Common Delegation Failures

| Failure | Cause | Prevention |
|---------|-------|------------|
| Wrong output | Unclear brief | Specific criteria, examples |
| Missed deadline | No check-ins | Regular updates |
| Quality issues | No standards | Quality checklist |
| Scope creep | Unclear boundaries | Written scope |
| Communication gaps | No channel defined | Set expectations |
| Over-dependence | No documentation | Build SOPs |

---

## Delegation Checklist

### Before Delegating

- [ ] Task is appropriate for delegation
- [ ] SOP exists or created
- [ ] Quality criteria defined
- [ ] Right person identified
- [ ] Budget allocated
- [ ] Tools/access ready

### During Handoff

- [ ] Written brief provided
- [ ] Walkthrough completed
- [ ] Questions answered
- [ ] Communication channels set
- [ ] First deadline agreed

### After First Delivery

- [ ] Output reviewed
- [ ] Feedback provided
- [ ] Process adjusted if needed
- [ ] Ongoing cadence set

---

## Scaling Delegation

### From Solo to Team

| Stage | Delegation Level | Focus |
|-------|------------------|-------|
| 0-1 | None | Build, validate |
| 1-2 | Task-level VAs | Free up time |
| 2-3 | Process-level freelancers | Build capacity |
| 3-4 | Outcome-level contractors | Scale functions |
| 4+ | Authority-level hires | Build organization |

### When to Expand

**Signals you need help:**
- Consistently working >50 hours
- Missing opportunities due to capacity
- Quality suffering
- Can't take vacation
- Growth is bottlenecked by you

**Ready to expand when:**
- Task takes >5 hours/week
- SOP exists and tested
- ROI is clearly positive
- Quality criteria defined

---

## Output Format

```markdown
## Delegation Plan: {Task/Function}

### Task Analysis
| Aspect | Assessment |
|--------|------------|
| Skill required | {Low/Medium/High} |
| Judgment required | {Low/Medium/High} |
| Frequency | {X per week} |
| Time per instance | {X hours} |
| SOP status | {Exists/Needed} |

### Delegation Decision
**Level:** {Task/Process/Outcome/Authority}
**To whom:** {VA/Freelancer/Contractor/Hire}
**Estimated cost:** ${X}/month
**ROI:** {hours saved × value - cost}

### Implementation
1. {Step 1}
2. {Step 2}
3. {Step 3}

### Success Criteria
- {Metric 1}: {target}
- {Metric 2}: {target}
```
